title: How long have you been playing the game without any punishment?
body:
Since there seems to be a lot of players complaining about the automated bans or flagging them for behavior that they believe is acceptable, how long have you been playing without being punished or banned?

I think I have been playing for 5+ years and have never had any chat restriction, ban, or punishment. I'm not sure why others find this hard to do.

replies.body: I mean, i got the mandatory "If you leave another game youll face penalties" message when comcast done did me a disservice once, but that was it. Been playing since pre S1
6 years

Well I started early 2014, so since then. They used to give you a notification if you'd been reported a lot so that you'd possibly cut out the behavior (but they stopped that because it was based on report volume and not report accuracy), I got one of those early on and I was like "Woah ok, I guess the League community isn't ok with that, I'll stop now".
I have 3 perm'd accounts and the last one was permd earlier this year :(

Your culture isn't being punished. You find it so easy because you literally don't have to change. You are free to be yourself.

Whereas "toxic" people, have probably been "toxic" their entire lives. They have to put effort into changing their culture or suffer punishments. 

Consider anger management classes. No one goes to a single class and is magically cured. It takes time and effort. The same for alcoholics anonymous. The same for any behavior really.
Consider playing this game as a chance to practice more mature and socially acceptable behavior then.  The excuse of “but I’m just naturally toxic” isn’t one that flies.

I've been playing since Season 2 without any "Real" punishment.  I've had 5 minute low priority Queues twice due to my spotty northwoods internet connection, but nothing at all other than that.

And just to clarify - I use the chat system pretty much every single game, for hundreds of games per season, using /all as well as team based chat.  

If you don't act like a hooligan you won't be treated like one.

No I think my mentality is fine. At least my team can see that im serious about them lowering my chances of winning a game. 

Sometimes I like putting pressure on my teammates so they can do better. Being nice never gets me anywhere, they just go and make the same mistakes over again becuase they think noone will care too much. I've seen some instances where my flame motivated a player to try harder so they can prove me wrong. 

Think of it like Gordon Ramsey and military generals. They both yell the shit out of people and spew insults. But do you see the recipients getting on a mental breakdown or something? No, because they are expected to have a thick skin and to do good under pressure, and to aknlowdege that someone is serious about them fucking up. Gordon Ramsey and military generals yell to *make* them do better to accomplish their goals.

Some of my teammates take criticism well actually. Besides, if they really didn't want to see my flame they can mute or ignore me. In my experience, being mean is better than being nice because your team knows that your serious about winning the game, and that you won't tolerate silly mistakes.

Nah, again, wrong mentality.  The examples you provided aren't similar situations to team cooperation on the Rift.  Each of us players are equal.  One isn't higher than the other.  One isn't head chef or general.  None of us work for or serve the other, we work TOGETHER.  It's possible to be constructive without being toxic and flaming.

However, if I started the game now and acted the way I did back then, I may have gotten a chat restriction or two lol, but I don't think I would've escalated to a ban. Just like how I learned my lesson from my first warning back then.

Since season 4 when i started with league. Honestly it's pretty easy to not get punished even when you're toxic. Just don't chat? I mean in the end it doesn't matter if u tell them they are bad at the game, because they would never say "yes you are right" because in all honestly, if they are in my elo, your elo or somebodys elses elo, we can assume that over a long number of games those players around our Elo are equal to us. Sometimes we do good, sometimes we do great, sometimes we do bad. We feed and we carry, we tilt hard and sometimes we tilt never. It happens to all of us.

If the average league player does bad in 1out of 10games which i would say is a fair number right? then in every single game on "average" we will meet a player who just has that 1game out of his "10" where he will do bad, **because there are 10Players playing right now one of them will have the bad game, assuming we as individuals are doing 1bad game in 10games**.

And no matter how many times someone flames him or how bad people trashtalk him, it won't make him play any better. therefore flaming is a waste of time.

If your reasoning for flaming is for example "he just needs to stop dying and i can maybe still carry" well then don't flame him but rather say, "try to play save i can carry this". It's up to your teammates if they are able to do it or not. But i hella know trashtalking will things make only worse, because when i do bad, and players trashtalk me, holy cow did i got tilted in the past from it. **until i learned the great option of using /mute all at every single game right from the start :>**

I started playing 2012.

I created this account about a week before Nocturne was released, so about 7 1/2 years ago. I haven't played that entire time, but still haven't gotten a punishment.
